Detailed Description

Irc user mask handling.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum KviIrcMask::MaskType
Enumerator:
NickUserHost 

nick!~user.host.top (default)

NickUserNet 

1 : nick!~user@*.abc.host.top

NickUser 

2 : nick!~user@*

NickHost 

3 : nick!*.host.top

NickNet 

4 : nick!*@*.abc.host.top

Nick 

5 : nick!*@*

UserHost 

6 : *!~user.host.top

UserNet 

7 : *!~user@*.abc.host.top

User 

8 : *!~user@*

Host 

9 : *!*.host.top

Net 

10 : *!*@*.abc.host.top

NickCleanUserHost 

11 : nick!*user.host.top

NickCleanUserNet 

12 : nick!*user@*.abc.host.top

NickCleanUser 

13 : nick!*user@*

CleanUserHost 

14 : *!*user.host.top

CleanUserNet 

15 : *!*user@*.abc.host.top

CleanUser 

16 : *!*user@*

NickUserLargeNet 

17 : nick!~user@*.host.top

NickLargeNet 

18 : nick!*@*.host.top

UserLargeNet 

19 : *!~user@*.host.top

NickCleanUserLargeNet 

20 : nick!*user@*.host.top

CleanUserLargeNet 

21 : *!*user@*.host.top

NickUserSmartNet 

22 : nick!~user@*.host.top

NickSmartNet 

23 : nick!*@*.host.top

UserSmartNet 

24 : *!~user@*.host.top

NickCleanUserSmartNet 

25 : nick!*user@*.host.top

CleanUserSmartNet 

26 : *!*user@*.host.top

void KviIrcMask::mask ( QString &  szMask,
MaskType  eMaskType = NickCleanUserHost 
) const

Returns in szMask the specified (if possible) mask of this user.

If the host or username are not known, the mask may contain less information than requested.

Parameters:
szMask The mask of the user
eMaskType The mask type
